title: Immunization Clinic at Pacific Spirit Community Health Centre | Vancouver Coastal Health
description: The Immunization Clinic at Pacific Spirit Community Health Centre provides seasonal and routine vaccinations, protecting us from the effects of a number of serious and potentially fatal infections and diseases like polio, diphtheria, measles and rubella.
cleaned_text: Immunization Clinic at Pacific Spirit Community Health Centre - 2110 West 43rd Avenue Vancouver, BC V6M 2E1 The Immunization Clinic at Pacific Spirit Community Health Centre provides seasonal and routine vaccinations, protecting us from the effects of a number of serious and potentially fatal infections and diseases like polio, diphtheria, measles and rubella. How to access - Check eligibility This service is only available to people living within the Vancouver Coastal Health authority region. If you live outside the VCH geographic region, contact your local health authority for information about immunization services in your area. - Contact us Call to make a routine immunization appointment for infants, toddlers, children starting kindergarten, school-age immunizations and adults. Remember to bring your [Child Health Passport](/en/child-health-passport)to record your child's current and past immunizations. Hours of operation - Monday: 8:30 am to 4:30 pm - Tuesday: 8:30 am to 4:30 pm - Wednesday: 8:30 am to 4:30 pm - Thursday: 8:30 am to 4:30 pm - Friday: 8:30 am to 4:30 pm - Saturday: Closed - Sunday: Closed Evening nursing service is available until 9 p.m. How to get here Paid street parking is available. There is also free street parking available close to the building. Accessible by transit on the #16 bus line. Kindergarten immunization days If your child is starting kindergarten this fall, bring them in for their free childhood immunizations. Call us to book an appointment. Pacific Spirit Community Health Centre Pacific Spirit Community Health Centre provides services for people of all ages. The centre works with community organizations and health-care providers, such as your family doctor, to keep people and communities healthy.
